cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 360 miles SSE of Lake Charles, LA and 380 miles SE of Galveston, TX
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northwest, then turning north-northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast near Sabine Pass/Port Arthur
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas–Louisiana border between Sea Rim State Park, TX and Cameron, LA (close to Port Arthur/Sabine Pass)

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane & Storm-Surge Warning from San Luis Pass, TX to the mouth of the Mississippi River (includes Port Arthur/Sabine Lake)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwestern Louisiana coastline
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (possible 100–120 mph gusts) expected Wednesday night–early Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge of 9–14 ft possible in Sabine Lake and adjacent areas, including Port Arthur
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated 15 inches, causing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents, widespread power outages likely
